intro: Boechera botulifructa, commonly known as the "puffball rockcress," is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its low-growing habit, with basal leaves and small, white to pale purple flowers. Its fruiting structures are unique, resembling tiny puffballs that release seeds when disturbed. Boechera botulifructa is often found in rocky or gravelly habitats and is adapted to arid environments.
